wikipedia_page.main: Nicholas Francis St Aubyn (born 19 November 1955) is a Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 2001 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1997 United Kingdom general election

response: The candidate succeeding Penhaligon was his then research assistant on the economy, Matthew Taylor, standing with the backing of the Social Democratic Party as part of the SDP-Liberal Alliance. The Conservative candidate was Nick St Aubyn who would go on to become member for Guildford. The Labour Party and Green Party put forward candidates. The only other candidate was Helen Anscomb, who represented Death off Road: Freight on Rail. Anscomb had previously taken part in four other by-elections of the 49th Parliament and on this occasion focused her campaign on the issue of road safety as Penhaligon had been killed in a car accident.
